body_html: @Jiaming-Liu If you fork your process, memory pages modified by either the parent or child process will be copied on write. So in theory, a snapshot is achieved. That is for central memory. I do not know what's going on for video memory. This will not work if you are using shared memory. If you want to first pickle in memory you can use a io.BytesIO and then dump it to disk. That should be slightly faster than dumping to disk directly even with an SSD.

body: @Jiaming-Liu If you fork your process, memory pages modified by either the parent or child process will be copied on write. So in theory, a snapshot is achieved. That is for central memory. I do not know what's going on for video memory. This will not work if you are using shared memory. If you want to first pickle in memory you can use a `io.BytesIO` and then dump it to disk. That should be slightly faster than dumping to disk directly even with an SSD.
